hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | Connecticut: Hartford: Limits On Cellphones

abstract.p: Connecticut House of Representatives approves bill that would outlaw use of hand-held cellular phones while driving and also reduce threshold for drunken driving from 0.10 percent blood-alcohol content to 0.08 percent (S)

block.p: The State House of Representatives yesterday approved a bill, 138 to 5, that would outlaw the use of hand-held cellular phones while driving and also reduce the threshold for drunken driving from 0.10 percent blood-alcohol content to 0.08 percent. If the state does not adopt the lower standard by next year, it will lose about $4 million in federal highway funds. The House passed a similar bill last year banning hand-held cell phones, without changing the drunken-driving law, but it failed in the Senate.
